clues.text: Full-figured women were celebrated by this painter, born June 28, 1577 of Flemish parents
In 1649 Frans Hals got philosophical painting this "cogito, ergo sum" thinker
In 1450 Haarlem's Dieric Bouts depicted "The Fall into" this place of suffering
In 1563 Pieter Bruegel the Elder spoke the language of art with a rendering of this structure mentioned in Genesis 11
Last name of the real guy who gave us "The Garden of Earthly Delights" & of the fictional guy who solves murders in Los Angeles
A city named for Sieur du Luth sits where he negotiated a treaty with the Sioux in what is now this state
When Robert Falcon Scott reached the South Pole in 1912, he found this country's flag left 5 weeks earlier by Amundsen
After conquering Cuba, Panfilo de Narvaez was tasked by Charles V to take this nearby peninsula
Sent to Africa in 1841 as a missionary, this Scotsman eventually started exploring the place, presumably
The island of Van Diemen's land, a name associated with Australian penal colonies, was renamed in 1855 for this Dutch explorer
We elect to inform you that Nov. 3, 2020 falls on this day of the week
Traditionally, this is the first full day of the Paschal Triduum, leading up to Easter
If tomorrow's today is Wednesday, then this is the day after tomorrow's yesterday
Seurat spent this "Afternoon on the Island of la Grande Jatte"
In a nursery rhyme, Solomon Grundy "died on" this day (but still had yet to be buried in the next line)
Home of the Redhawks, Miami University is in this state
Santa Fe Community College is in Sante Fe, N.M.; Sante Fe College is in this city home to the Univ. of Florida
The oldest in Kentucky, a university in Lexington bears this name that sounds like Dracula might have been an alumnus
Founded in 1853, Washington University isn't in D.C. or Washington State but in this city on the Mississippi river
Oakland University isn't in California, it's in this state's cities of Auburn Hills & Rochester Hills
It's the business end of a fishhook
A short promotional statement found on a book cover
This title film creature was based on an actual 1950 police report about a mysterious gelatinous mass found in a field
This type of restaurant/bar makes its own beer & serves it on the premises
An Old Testament Philistine god & a New Testament devil, his name means "lord of the flies"
EW for short, in 2019 this magazine about pop culture kept its name but went monthly
A travel magazine launched in 2017 is named for this room-renting app
In 2000 Time announced that this other 4-letter magazine would no longer be monthly & would only publish special issues
A lot of "the usual gang of idiots" were out of work when this humor magazine went to mostly reprinting old material in 2019
This long-running magazine started publishing a "Little Kids" edition to teach youngsters 3-6 about our big world
From December 16 to 24, Mexico commemorates the journey this biblical pair took from Nazareth to Bethlehem
This holiday has its origins in the Celtic festival of Samhain, during which people wore masks to avoid being recognized by ghosts
First held in 1897, it's now run on Patriots' Day in April each year
LGBTQ Pride Month is celebrated each June to commemorate the 1969 riots at this inn
This Utah festival regularly has more than 12,000 films submitted; about 200 end up getting shown
Captain Jack Sparrow in "Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl"
Griet, the title gal in 2003's "Girl with a Pearl Earring"
This lead singer as himself in the 2017 Pearl Jam concert film "Let's Play Two"
Rafe & Danny, 2 fighter pilots triangulating with Kate Beckinsale in 2001's "Pearl Harbor"
Sherlock Holmes, opposite Nigel Bruce as Dr. Watson in 1944's "The Pearl of Death"

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will be a word that starts with the letters "S-W-I" and come just before "swine" in the dictionary.)

clues.text: Tracy Caulkins won 3 Olympic golds in this
Rapid, or a rapid bird
It's real hogwash
Watch out for this con man
This sweeper started cleaning floors in 1999; the wet system soon followed
Concentrations of these, like methane & carbon dioxide, have driven climate change
With this service your paycheck goes straight into your bank account
Colorful term for an aristocrat or a member of a socially prominent family
In high school, courses such as history, geography & civics come under this heading
French phrase for an attractive but dangerous woman

rounds.comments: (Alex: We want you to replace the word "Jeopardy!" in each clue.)

clues.text: "O Jeopardy!, Jeopardy!, wherefore art thou Jeopardy!?"
"Get thee to a Jeopardy!"
"The better part of Jeopardy! is discretion"
"Life's but a walking Jeopardy!"
"Why, man, he doth bestride the narrow world like a Jeopardy!"
The king of beasts has one around its neck
It can be a single hair, or a string of pearls
"Fruity" 2-word term for fine hair that's growing for the first time
This hairstyle named for another native people was popular among the Ottawa, who were known as the "raised hair"
French gives us the name of this "chi"-chi hairstyle, a large coil of hair worn at the nape of the neck

rounds.text: In September 1964 the New York Times announced the passing of this pet, a gift, "used as symbol of honesty in 1952"
